lines.content: **Sphene** is a chatbot inspired by the titular character in *Final Fantasy XIV*.
Sphene helps you **keep track of your tasks** with ease via a command line interface.
Adds a todo task to the task list.
- `[content]`: The details of the todo task.
**Output:** The chatbot displays the new task list.
Adds a deadline to the task list.
- `[deadlineTime]`: The due time of the deadline, in ISO format `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss`
**Output:** The chatbot displays the new task list.
Adds a event to the task list.
- `[startTime]`: The start time of the event, in ISO format `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss`
- `[endTime]`: The end time of the event, in ISO format `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss`
**Output:** The chatbot displays the new task list.
Prints all tasks in the task list.
**Output:** The chatbot displays all tasks in the task list, in the following format:
`<index>. [<type>][<mark status>] <details> (<relevant times in case of deadlines or events>)`
Marks a task in the list as done.
- `[index]`: The index of the task to mark as done, as shown by `list`
**Output:** The chatbot displays the new task list.
Removes the mark of a task in the list.
- `[index]`: The numerical index of the task to unmark, as shown by `list`
**Output:** The chatbot displays the new task list.
Deletes a task from the list
- `[index]`: The index of the task to delete, as shown by `list`
**Output:** The chatbot displays the new task list.
Finds tasks in the list whose details contain a given string.
**Output:** The chatbot displays the tasks in the list, whose details contain the given string.
Sorts the task list in chronological order.
For deadlines, the due time is used. For events, the start time is used. Todos are always placed at the end of the list.
**Output:** The chatbot displays the new task list.
The task list is saved at `data/tasks.txt` after any command which modifies the list - no manual action

**Sphene** is a chatbot inspired by the titular character in *Final Fantasy XIV*.
Sphene helps you **keep track of your tasks** with ease via a command line interface.
Adds a todo task to the task list.
- `[content]`: The details of the todo task.
**Output:** The chatbot displays the new task list.
Adds a deadline to the task list.
- `[deadlineTime]`: The due time of the deadline, in ISO format `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss`
**Output:** The chatbot displays the new task list.
Adds a event to the task list.
- `[startTime]`: The start time of the event, in ISO format `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss`
- `[endTime]`: The end time of the event, in ISO format `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss`
**Output:** The chatbot displays the new task list.
Prints all tasks in the task list.
**Output:** The chatbot displays all tasks in the task list, in the following format:
`<index>. [<type>][<mark status>] <details> (<relevant times in case of deadlines or events>)`
Marks a task in the list as done.
- `[index]`: The index of the task to mark as done, as shown by `list`
**Output:** The chatbot displays the new task list.
Removes the mark of a task in the list.
- `[index]`: The numerical index of the task to unmark, as shown by `list`
**Output:** The chatbot displays the new task list.
Deletes a task from the list
- `[index]`: The index of the task to delete, as shown by `list`
**Output:** The chatbot displays the new task list.
Finds tasks in the list whose details contain a given string.
**Output:** The chatbot displays the tasks in the list, whose details contain the given string.
Sorts the task list in chronological order.
For deadlines, the due time is used. For events, the start time is used. Todos are always placed at the end of the list.
**Output:** The chatbot displays the new task list.
The task list is saved at `data/tasks.txt` after any command which modifies the list - no manual action

private static final Pattern PATTERN_TODO = Pattern.compile(" *(.*)");
private static final Pattern PATTERN_FIND = Pattern.compile(" *(.*)");
private static final Pattern PATTERN_DEADLINE = Pattern.compile(" *(.*)/by *(.*)");
private static final Pattern PATTERN_EVENT = Pattern.compile(" *(.*)/from *(.*)/to *(.*)");
private static final Pattern PATTERN_MARK = Pattern.compile(" *(-?[0-9]+) *");
private static final Pattern PATTERN_UNMARK = PATTERN_MARK;
private static final Pattern PATTERN_DELETE = PATTERN_MARK;

* Handles the input the user just submitted via the chatbox.

window.showSpheneDialog("How can I serve you today, my dear citizen?");
window.showSpheneDialog("I hope to serve you again, my dear citizen!");

* @param command The command where the exception occurs.
* @param params The parameters of the command.
* @param field The field where the exception occurs.
public EmptyFieldException(String command, String params, String field) {
return "Field '" + this.field + "' in command '" + this.getCommand() + "' should not be empty";
return "The field '" + this.field + "' in the request '" + this.getCommand() + "' should not be empty.";
* Exception thrown when a field in a command is not a valid datetime.
* Creates a new invalid datetime exception.
* @param command The command where the exception occurs.
* @param field The field where the exception occurs.
* @param value The value of the field.
public InvalidDateTimeException(String command, String field, String value) {
return "Field '" + this.field + "' in command '" + this.getCommand() + "' has value " + this.value
return "The field '" + this.field + "' in the request '" + this.getCommand() + "' has value " + this.value
+ ". It is not a valid time!\n"
* Exception thrown when field(s) in a command do not form a valid datetime range.
* Creates a new invalid datetime range exception.
* @param command The command where the exception occurs.
* @param field The field(s) where the exception occurs.
* @param startTime The start datetime of the range where the exception occurs.
* @param endTime The end datetime of the range where the exception occurs.
return "Field '" + this.field + "' in command '" + this.getCommand() + "' has range "
+ this.endTime + ", not a valid datetime range";
return "The field '" + this.field + "' in the request '" + this.getCommand() + "' has range "
+ ". It is not a valid datetime range!";
* Exception thrown when a field in a command does not form a valid integer.
* Creates a new invalid integer exception.
* @param command Command where the exception occurs.
* @param field Field where the exception occurs.
public InvalidIntException(String command, String field, String value) {
return "Field '" + this.field + "' in command '" + this.getCommand() + "' has value " + this.value
return "The field '" + this.field + "' in the request '" + this.getCommand() + "' has value " + this.value
+ ". It is not a valid number!\n";

+ ". It is outside the range of valid list indices!";

return "Failed to save to file " + filePath;

return "Syntax error from command: " + this.getCommand() + "with parameters: " + this.getParams();
return "You didn't use the correct format for the request '" + this.getCommand() + "'!";
